title: Efficient Semiparametric Estimation of Average Treatment Effects Under Covariate Adaptive Randomization. (arXiv:2305.08340v1 [econ.EM])
abstract: Experiments that use covariate adaptive randomization (CAR) are commonplace in applied economics and other fields. In such experiments, the experimenter first stratifies the sample according to observed baseline covariates and then assigns treatment randomly within these strata so as to achieve balance according to pre-specified stratum-specific target assignment proportions. In this paper, we compute the semiparametric efficiency bound for estimating the average treatment effect (ATE) in such experiments with binary treatments allowing for the class of CAR procedures considered in Bugni, Canay, and Shaikh (2018, 2019). This is a broad class of procedures and is motivated by those used in practice. The stratum-specific target proportions play the role of the propensity score conditional on all baseline covariates (and not just the strata) in these experiments. Thus, the efficiency bound is a special case of the bound in Hahn (1998), but conditional on all baseline covariates. Additiona

translated_title: 基于协变量适应性随机化的平均处理效应的高效半参数估计
translated_abstract: 在应用经济学和其他领域中，广泛使用使用协变量适应性随机化（CAR）的实验。在这种实验中，实验者首先根据观察到的基线协变量对样本进行分层，然后在这些分层内随机分配治疗，以达到按预先规定的分层特定目标分配比例平衡。本文计算二进制处理情况下考虑在Bugni、Canay和Shaikh（2018, 2019）中考虑的CAR程序类中平均处理效应（ATE）的半参数效率边界，这是一种广泛使用的程序类，并且受到实践的启发。在这些试验中，分层特定的目标比例在所有基线协变量（而不仅仅是分层）的条件下扮演概率得分的角色。因此，效率边界是Hahn（1998）中边界的特例，但在所有基线协变量的条件下。此外，我们提出了一种半参数估计器，用于在CAR过程下实现效率界限，并开发了一种数据驱动的方法来选择目标分配比例。我们的估计器计算效率高，可以处理大量的分层和协变量。通过模拟研究，我们证明了估计器的有限样本性能，并将我们的方法应用于现实世界的实验。
tldr: 本文提出了一种基于协变量适应性随机化的平均处理效应的高效半参数估计方法，通过计算效率界限和开发数据驱动的选择目标分配比例的方法来实现。这一方法可以处理大量的分层和协变量。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes an efficient semiparametric estimator for the average treatment effect under covariate adaptive randomization (CAR), which can handle a large number of strata and covariates. The efficiency bound is computed and a data-driven approach is developed for choosing the target assignment proportions. The proposed estimator achieves the efficiency bound and is demonstrated through simulation and real-world experiments.
